data.title: Best Bread
data.text: Great bread.  No preservatives so store in frig. especially in warm weather.  I like to call-in a couple of days prior to pick-up and purchase multiple loaves and freeze the spares.  Good pie crusts (order ahead) that come in a deep aluminum pay.  Ok to freeze also.

data.title: Great local Bakery.
data.text: Friends recommended this local bakery.  Can't beat the great coffee, great pastries, and friendly staff.  I wish there were more local bakeries like this one.

data.title: Yummy coffee.
data.text: We end up here often because it's our favorite coffee and breakfast pastries in town. Service and ambiance are good but the quality and flavor is where it's at. You won't go wrong for coffee and a companion here.

data.title: Excellant Lunches, Love the Baked Goods
data.text: Went there for lunch, cafateria style, stand in line place your order, take a number, sit at a table, they will bring your food to you.  Had a wonderful fresh salad, The Bakery goods looked wonderful.  Have had there breads and they are really good, can also find them in local grocery stores.

data.title: Coffee and pastries
data.text: If you are looking for a quaint little place to enjoy coffee and pastries along with other goodies this is the place to visit. Every thing looked so yummy! Wish I could have sampled them all.

data.title: Love that it was close to the hotel we stayed at
data.text: Tin Roof bread is amazing. The employees are happy, alert, and very nice! I recommend their sour dough and the ciabatta bread. Also a plus that it's right across the street from the hotel we were staying at

data.title: Best cafe in Chico and Beyond
data.text: Kale salad - tea - scones - cookies - soups - bread - everything about Tin Roof is spectacular! And the wonderful people that work there!

data.title: Yummy for sure
data.text: So good. So yummy. Get your cravings satisfied. Friendly,  safe and inviting to eat in or to take away. Keeps us coming back every weekend.

data.title: Coffee and pastries!
data.text: The coffee and pastries are always on point here. We can't get away from stopping here. Everything we have tried is mouth watering good!!

data.title: Terrific bakery & wonderful lunch spot too!
data.text: Delicious baked goods & healthy, yummy lunch specials!  The soup! The Salads! The fabulous breads & sandwiches!  Beware you shall not be able to resist the pies , cakes & cookies!

data.title: Great Little Bakery in a Great Town
data.text: My family has a Saturday tradition of purchasing cookies, muffins, quiches and coffee/chai here. The staff are fairly quick and the food is good. It is quite cramped in the dining area due to the lines and the setup, but it is manageable. The one thing to me that needs improving stat is the acquiring of another oven to heat the brunch offerings. You literally can be put in a long line of people and they heat ONE item at a time. So by the time my breakfast sandwich is heated, my family is typically done with a muffin and ready to walk home. I think two more ovens would suffice and please your customers.  Thank you for your consideration of this idea. ;)

data.title: Bad Birthday Cake
data.text: I bought a Red Velvet Birthday cake for my son and the cake was so hard and dried out that is was difficult to cut with a steak knife. The frosting was so stale that it was gummy. Very disappointing.

data.title: Bread Isn't the Only Tasty Item
data.text: This bakery is good enough to be in the San Francisco Bay Area.  Their Lemon Croissants, the Apple Galettes, their incredible breads,  and their soups and salads are wonderful.  I have never been disappointed...ever!  So many  delicious items, that are not offered anywhere else in town...you can't go wrong.

data.title: Save your Money and Head Over to Great Harvest Baking Company
data.text: Arrogant staff and owners make this a terrible place to visit.  It's so bad, I won't do business with businesses tht do business with them.

data.title: Better than mom's...and gluten free options
data.text: Another Chico favorite.  Fresh baked breads, scones, rolls, muffins and much more with a variety of sourdoughs and grains, as well.  They also serve the Saturday Farmer's Market.  Clean ingredients, lots of variety, that fresh baked smell that makes your mouth water when you walk in.

data.title: Fresh home made pastries.
data.text: On Broadwat, down town. The best fresh baked breads and pastries. Also have Glutten Free items. Great coffee drinks as well. A good place to meet with a friend and enjoy a treat.

data.title: Go ONLY for their bread
data.text: Their bread my be great but don't go for their cafe. I ordered a double shot of espresso that was so under extracted that it tasted like a coffee flavored sour patch candy.  It topped my list as worst espresso I have had, and I have been to a lot of places.

data.title: Made Fresh!
data.text: Just stopped in for coffee, which was fabulous, and gazed upon rows of fresh baked breads and pastries, sandwiches, soups, and small bites! I wish I had been hungry! Everything looked awesome. Very friendly staff. The place looked clean and well run. Will return with a hearty lunch appetite!

data.title: Coffee and food is excellent
data.text: During our visit to Chico we went to this venue a few times. Each time the food and coffee were excellent. You might want to try the Cronut - a combination of a croissant and donut that was very tasty. Coffee was consistently excellent and the service friendly and efficient. Well worth the visit

data.title: Yummy Lunch!
data.text: I love the sandwiches and salads they serve for lunch, but don't be late cause they tend to run out. Of course, dessert is always a must! My favorite is the Chico cupcake with chocolate cake, buttercream frosting with almonds sprinked atop and lastly in the center of the frosting a well of caramel...Could it get any better than that!
